bio: Photographer for National Geographic and NY Times Magazine, creating an aerial perspective on climate change and global food supply @feedtheplanet

posts.caption: Harvesting #riesling grapes on the steepest farmland in Europe, above the #Mosel River in Germany. Grapes were first planted here by the Romans, and ancient stone walls help to keep the soil in place. If you pinch and zoom on the left you can see the new motorized monorail built to carry the grapes down to the road over 300 ft. below. This precious hectare takes six people four days to harvest, and will yield 3,500 prized bottles of #BremmerCalmont To see more about where our food comes from follow @FeedThePlanet
Pyramids as seen yesterday from the deserted bar of a five star hotel.

Majiek Gai Chan, 15 y.o., lies on the ground after being cut with the knife that will mark him as a man in #Nuer society. This ancient custom was once common throughout #SouthSudan, but has become increasingly rare as youth choose to keep their tribal identity more private and become socially accepted in the modern world. The boys are cut in birth order, and were all eager to follow the tradition of their people. A village elder told me:”If you make the mark, you are a strong man. You will not be afraid again." Shortly after the cutting, one proud father sacrificed a cow to celebrate the manhood of his first son, and shared the meat with the village. #anthropology in the 21st Century

Butterfly catcher with a sample of the his wares near M’Bata, Central African Republic, which are exported to collectors all over the world through a missionary organization. Each butterfly specie is associated with a particular kind of tree, and appear once a year during the flowering event of the tree’s life cycle. To catch them he walks along a forest trail putting out daubs of dog excrement mixed with his own urine, and the butterflies come down from the canopy to feed on this pungent and nutrient rich mixture. I was amazed to watch the most beautiful things in the world be attracted to the most foul concoction imaginable. As my mother used to say, “there is just no accounting for taste”

Sandstone pinnacles in the Central Sahara, slowly being eroded back into sand. Paramotoring has opened me up to seeing remote areas in a new way. #PlanetChad #notadrone #LooksGoodYouGoFirst #DesertAirBook
Outrigger canoe plying the turquoise shallows of Tabiteuea Atoll in Kiribati #SouthPacific #Micronesia #notadrone

The Vertical Forest, a pair of eco-futurist residential towers (at right) in Milan's Porta Nuova district designed by Boeri Studio. They have over 900 trees on their balconies to help mitigate CO2 and moderate temperatues inside the building. As seen at sunrise yesterday. Always fashionable... Ciao Milano! #BoscoVerticale #Boeri #architeture #urbanforest

I didn’t go crazy with Photoshop! This is what the #greenhouses actually look like in the winter months over Koppert Cress, who grow micro-greens for #gourmet chefs throughout Europe and the Middle East. They use magenta frequency LEDs to extend their growing season. Plants don’t absorb green light, so magenta LEDs use less power. The Dutch are masterfully efficient farmers, making the most of their limited resources. #futureoffarming

Main growing room for #micro-greens at Koppert Cress in The Netherlands. Their newest area has pink LED lighting to improve the uniformity of their hydroponically grown sprouts. Their plants don’t use the green part of the spectrum for #photosynthesis, so this is a more energy efficient way to extend their growing season. Yet another example of Dutch leadership in #hydroponics. After a few minutes inside this room my eyes adjusted and it looked close to daylight, while my phone screen appeared electric green. #GroundControlToMajorTom
Flood lights are ready for the evening sound and light show. The #pyramids are still here, even if the tourists aren’t.
I guess we won’t be having sushi tonight! Along the Afghan border, near Zabol, Iran.

The half moon rose around 11PM while I slept out in the #WhiteDesert. The bedrock here is composed of soft white chalk that has been sculpted by strong winds into strange and beautiful shapes. So excited to be returning to #Egypt tonight, and connect with this ancient land in a new way.
This was the view while leaning out of my paraglider harness over the Pyramids of Giza last week. #notadrone #forgotmyaltimeter

During the preliminary elections in South Sudan a few years ago, a blossoming politician raised his arms in victory. The particpants had rejected formal balloting, and did it the tribal way of the Nuer, by lining up behind their candidate. Somehow it seemed more natural to me, with no ballots or privacy, and no accusations of cheating. #nicesuit

School lunch hour on the once a month traditional day in Bonagai village on Kiriwina, in the Trobriand Islands.

This picture was taken on a six-week trip by private sailboat through the seldom-visited islands north of New Guinea, in an area of the South Pacific known as the Solomon Sea. Most of the islets here have no airport or regularly scheduled boat services, and their way of life is traditional by economic necessity. #anthropology #trobriandislands #Malinowski

location.location_name: Losuia, Milne Bay, Papua New Guinea

posts.caption: #Rwanda has the highest rural population density of any country in #Africa, and intense competition for farm land has pushed people to cultivate on every scrap of terrain. #africanairbook
Pyramid of Khafre, 2,500 B.C.. as seen yesterday. I couldn’t stop imagining of the sight of it being built, with the mass of humanity toiling to satisfy one man’s quest for eternity. #notadrone

More people that have stood on the surface of the moon than walked the length of Grand Canyon -- it’s long, hard and there is no trail. My friend  @pedromcbride chose the challenge of walking the length of the canyon because he wanted to document it before it potentially changes from growing developments around it. 13 months and 750-miles later, he did and now he has a new book showcasing what he captured on one camera.  You can see how to buy it at the link in his bio @pedromcbride #grandcanyon #betweeenriverandrim Check it out!!!

Village life along the Niger River near Gao, Mali. Summer rains have brought the river to flood stage, allowing a rice crop on the edge the Sahara. This section of the Niger offers a glimpse into the agricultural system that existed along parts of the Nile before the dams were built. #AfricanAirBook #paramotor

They call it red cabbage, but it sure looked blue a few days ago in the fields north of Amsterdam. The Dutch are the #2 exporter of agriculture in the world, and have raised farm efficiency to an art form. #Diebenkorn

Big Lagoon, Shark Bay, Western Australia, where climate change is causing increasing ocean temperatures and salinity in the shallow tidal waters. #climatechangeisreal #notadrone #onassignment for @NYTMag @PulitzerCenter

Traditional family oases still survive in the hollows of the Grand Erg Occidental, Algeria. They have built sand fences with palm fronds to slow the advance of the mobile #dunes, and protect their date palms and vegetable #garden from eventual inundation. There is a shallow fresh water #aquifer here, and the water was traditionally brought up by ropes and pulleys, often with the aid of a donkey. The introduction of electrical pumps has made life a little easier in the Sahara, but also led to over use, and the water table is dropping. #oasis #notadrone #DesertAirBook

First tracks in the Antarctic spring open up the Bulgarian research station on Livingston Island, #Antarctica. We had sailed down through mountainous seas from Argentina with a season’s worth of food, and supplies, but getting it to shore was a challenge in the dinghy. The Bulgarians had to wear to survival suits to carry their supplies through the surf onto the icy/rocky shore. Working in such remote locations is an experience earned with fortitude. #StKlimentOhridkski @oceanexpeditions

location.location_name: Piazza Duomo Milano - The Duomo Square Milan

posts.caption: Seaweed farming is one of the few ways to make a little money in the lagoon of Tabiteuea Island in Kiribati. #Aquaculture started here over twenty years ago, and the crop grows quickly on nylon ropes staked into the shallow sand. The harvest is floated to shore on small rafts and then dried for export, to be used as an emulsifier in various products. While sunlight and clear water are abundant in the Central Pacific, transportation is not. There are no scheduled flights to this remote atoll, and I had to charter a tri-maran for the two day trip to get here. #sustainability in agriculture is complicated, and will be part of my discussion today in Milan for the @BCFNFoundation

Sunset on Aït Benhaddou, an ancient caravan town in Morocco that has been restored for use in Hollywood movies. #LawrenceOfArabia #TheGladiator Although it is a big tourist attraction with 1000+ visitors/day, the Kasbah is still occupied by the locals. On a calm winter afternoon, the history seemed to come alive when seen from the seat of my paraglider. #UNESCOWorldHeritage #africanairbook

Flowers sprout from the tip of the strange-looking Boojum tree in the granitic hills of Baja California, #Mexico. Here the cardón cacti of the Sonoran Desert mix in as the botany transitions to that of the California coast. #cactus #Sonoran #desert #cardón #DrSeuss #cacti #Sonoran #desert #cardón #Cirio
A Russian priest on his way to church in Antarctica, Belnghausen Station, King George V Island. #keepingthefaith #EasternOrthodox #relgion

I didn’t go heavy with Photoshop! This is what the #greenhouses actually looked like this morning when I flew my drone over Koppert Cress, who grow micro-greens for gourmet chefs throughout Europe and the Middle East. They use magenta frequency LEDs to extend their growing season and assure product uniformity. Plants don’t absorb green light, so magenta LEDs are more power efficient. Business is expanding so fast that they are buying up the whole neighborhood! @WorldFoodDayNL
So now I’m out of ideas for things to shoot in The Netherlands tomorrow, and open to suggestion!

Aerial view of terraced farms of the Naxi minority, at 6,500 ft. in the hills of Yunnan province in China. Flat land is precious in this part of China, and the carefully tended terraces are rotated to grow millet, cabbage, corn and wheat. China is a combination of modern and ancient practices. Around the globe, improved soil practices via biotech have ensured that an extra 6,586 million KG of soil carbon was sequestered in 2016 alone. According to non-profit @ISAAA_org, that’s equivalent to 24,172 million KG of carbon dioxide not being released into the global atmosphere.
#ClimateActionDay #ACT4SDGs #SDGs #sponsored

François Lagarde using his #paraglider to examine an unusual kind of #barchan dune in the crater of Arakao, Niger. I’ve always found reality to be more interesting than imagination. As the early 20th Century evolutionary biologist John Haldane put it: my own suspicion is that the Universe is not only queerer than we suppose, but queerer than we can suppose. #notadrone

Robert Smithson’s iconic artwork Spiral Jetty, as seen in 2002 when it first emerged from The Great Salt Lake after being submerged for decades. Smithson didn’t realize that the lake was in severe drought when he built it in 1970, and lake fluctuations continue to transform the work. The jetty is now entirely out of the water. #spiraljetty #EarthArt #LandArt @diaartfoundation

Volubilis has the best preserved Roman ruins in Morocco, and was the wealthiest city in NW Africa during the 2nd and 3rd Century AD. At its peak it had a population of 20,000, and from above I could see the fine Roman mosaics that decorated its ancient floors. #UNESCOWorldHeritage #AfricanAirBook

Epic flying today over the pyramids of Giza. I had tried for years, and was turned down even with Egyptian military helicopters. Last week Egypt hosted the world paramotor championships, and suddenly the impossible happened. This is me, the last one to land last night. #bucketlist.
Four time Paramotor World Champion @morillasramon and his 20 year old protégé @nicoaubert10, having big fun over the Pyramids of Giza last week. 🇪🇸 + 🇪🇸 #paramotor #paragliding #JustDoIt

location.location_name: The Great Pyramid of Giza, Cairo, Egypt
